StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveRetrainCourse]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @RetrainCourseID uniqueiden..er, @RetrainID uniqueiden..er, @CID varchar(20), @ClassNumber varchar(10), @DateReport date.me, @DateClassBegin date.me, @DateClassGradua.on date.me ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT RetrainCourseID FROM [dbo].[RetrainCourse] WHERE [RetrainCourseID] = @RetrainCourseID) BEGIN UPDATE [dbo].[RetrainCourse] SET [RetrainID] = @RetrainID, [CID] = @CID, [ClassNumber] = @ClassNumber, [DateReport] = @DateReport, [DateClassBegin] = @DateClassBegin, [DateClassGradua.on] = @DateClassGradua.on WHERE [RetrainCourseID] = @RetrainCourseID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[RetrainCourse] ( [RetrainCourseID], [RetrainID], [CID], [ClassNumber], [DateReport], [DateClassBegin], [DateClassGradua.on] ) VALUES ( @RetrainCourseID, @RetrainID, @CID, @ClassNumber, @DateReport, @DateClassBegin, @DateClassGradua.on )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
